data: Everybody knows Canterbury, with its Old-World charms and its ostentatious air of being content to be rather behind the times, of looking down upon the hurrying Americans who dash through its cathedral and take snap-shots at its slums, and at all those busy moderns who cannot afford to take life at its own jog-trot pace.
The Wharf by the Docks: A Novel
browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: romance|category: novels|category: british literature
